entry.title: STUDIO RHE - MARCH 2016 - CURRENT
entry.content:
Key Project: 9 DALLINGTON STREET
Overview: CAT B refurbishment and roof extension in Shoreditch.
Role: Project Architect
Client: Brockton Capital
Sector: CAT B, Mixed-Use, Co-Working, Bar + Cafe
Value: £9 million
Stages: 3 - 4

In my current role as Part III Architect at Studio RHE I have been running 9 Dallington Street, a 3000 M SQ, CAT B office refurbishment, fit out, and roof extension, with a bar and cafe in Shoreditch. I inherited this project at Stage 3 and prepared a planning application, in tandem with producing the detailed design and full tender package. I am responsible for the day to day running of this project, including attending design team meetings, monitoring site progress and giving client presentations. One of the key aspects of this project, as with any, has been managing client expectations. I thoroughly enjoy this aspect of my role as an architect, building lasting professional relationships and working collaboratively with the client and design team to deliver mutually considered, high quality projects.

entry.title: BARR GAZETAS - 2012 - 2015
entry.content:
Key Project: QUADRANT ARCADE, REGENT STREET, LONDON
Overview: Grade II Listed Retail Destination on Regent Street
Role: Project Architect + Lead Designer
Client: The Crown Estate
Sector: Public realm, Retail + Conservation
Value: £4 million
Stages: 0 - 3

Key Project: MICHAEL PALIN CENTRE, CLERKENWELL, LONDON
Overview : Speach + Language Centre, therapy Space
Role: Project Architect + Lead Designer
Client: Whittington Health + Action For Stammering Children
Sector: Health Care
Value: £250,000
Stages: A - L

Key Project: 7 AIR STREET, LONDON
Overview: Award winning, Grade II Listed, office retrofit and refurbishment + BREEAM Outstanding
Role: Part II Architectuaral Assistant
Client: The Crown Estate
Sector: Commercial, Office + Conservation
Value: £16 million
Stages: A - E

Key Project: 21 GLASSHOUSE STREET, REGENT STREET, LONDON [APPLE HQ]
Overview : Grade II listed, CAT A office retrofit and refurbishment + BREEAM Excellent
Role: Part II Architectural Assistant
Client: The Crown Estate
Sector: Commercial, Office & Conservation
Value: £8 million
Stages: A - K

During my time at Barr Gazetas I contributed to a large range of projects in both size and sector, spanning stages 1 - 7 of the RIBA plan of work. Key projects include the retrofit of three Grade II listed buildings on Regent Street and an extension to The Michael Palin Centre in Clerkenwell. As protected sites, the schemes demanded thoughtful, sensitive and innovative planning, which proved to be both challenging and rewarding. I gained valuable on site exoerience and was a direct point of contact for the main contractor. I have also gained experience, and much success, in working with the directors to pitch for new work.

entry.title: LAWRAY ARCHITECTS SUMMER 2010
entry.content:
Key Project: EGERTON CRESCENT, KENSINGTON
Overview: Grade II listed residence in Kensington
Role: Part II Architectural Assistant
Client: Private
Sector: Residential
Value: £1 million
Stages: F - G
BARTON WILLMORE

During the summer at Lawray I worked producing drawings and specifications for construction as well as preparing a tender submission. I also worked as the in-house graphic designer, assembling and laying out concept design, feasibility and technical reports. I designed and bound a series of booklets outlining the work of the practice categorised into relevant sectors.

entry.title: BARTON WILLMORE 2008 - 2009
entry.content:
Key Project: FRANKLANDS DRIVE, RUNNYMEED, SURREY
Overview: 350 affordable homes attaining a minimum of Code Level 3 compliance
Role: Part I Architectural Assistant
Client: Elmbridge Housing Trust
Sector: Residential
Stages: A - D

Key Project: POPLAR BUSINESS PARK, LONDON
Overview: Mixed use tower
Role: Architectural Assistant
Client: Anthony Kingston
Sector: Mixed Use: Residential, Retail, Commercial, Hotel + Public Realm
Stages: A - C

I was part of the architectural design team within a multidisciplinary office of planners and landscape architects. I worked on a range of projects including one off houses, a scheme for 350 affordable homes and a mixed use residential and commercial high-rise in the city of London. Whilst working at Barton Willmore, I tightened my time management abilities, gained experience in dealing with clients and grasped the reality of the professional demands and responsibilities of the architect.

entry.title: ELLIOT DESIGN, IRELAND SUMMER 2006 & SUMMER 2007
entry.content:
Role: Part I Architectural Assistant
Overview: Produced planning drawings for residential extensions.

entry.title: EAGLESHAM ARCHITECTS - 2013
entry.content:
Project: 8 CANONBURY SQUARE, LONDON
Overview: Extension to a listed residence in Islington
Role: Part II Architectural Assistant
Client: Private
Sector: Residential
Value: £2 million
Stages: A - E
